title: Covid-19: Five years on, search for origin of SARS-CoV-2 remains fruitless
summary: Five years after the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, the two main hypotheses – illegal wildlife trade and a laboratory accident – remain unresolved.

title: New Orleans attack: suspect was US-born army veteran and had Islamic State flag
summary: At least 15 people were killed and dozens injured Wednesday when a pickup truck plowed into a New Year's crowd in the heart of New Orleans, authorities said. The FBI said the driver was dead and that it was investigating the attack as an act of terrorism.

title: Poland's EU presidency promises to be highly political
summary: On the strength of his European experience and his membership of the EPP, the dominant party in Brussels, Prime Minister Donald Tusk intends to demonstrate that his government's pro-European choices are the right ones, ahead of the Polish presidential election in May.

title: An exceptional account of Iranian prisons
summary: Columnist Jean-Pierre Filiu notes how Fariba Adelkhah goes beyond the prison diary to deliver an anthropology of the prison system in Iran, analyzed from the inside as never before following her detention in Tehran from 2019 to 2023.

title: How 10-minute delivery services are revolutionizing commerce in India
summary: Platforms offering ultra-fast delivery services are booming in the world's most populous country, where they can recruit an almost unlimited workforce. This disruption is destabilizing small, traditional stores.

title: Victor Wembanyama's ever-improving performances charm San Antonio
summary: Soon to turn 21, the French star of the San Antonio Spurs is off to a fine start to his second season, and is proving to be a serious contender for a spot in the NBA All-Star Game.

title: Tesla Cybertruck explodes outside Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one
summary: Video footage shows the stainless steel vehicle parked at the hotel entrance before bursting into flames. Authorities said there was 'one deceased individual inside the Cybertruck' while seven people received 'minor' injuries.

title: An armed man kills at least ten people, including two children, in a shooting rampage in Montenegro
summary: The gunman killed the owner of a bar in the city of Cetinje, the bar owner's children and his own family members, authorities said on Wednesday. He later died after shooting himself.

title: Palestinian Authority suspends Al Jazeera broadcasts
summary: Tensions between the Doha-based network and the Fatah movement of Palestinian President Mahmud Abbas, have risen in recent weeks following the channel's coverage of clashes between Palestinian security forces and militants in Jenin.

title: A year of crisis in French Parliament, in photos
summary: Photojournalist Julien Muguet regularly works for Le Monde, covering events at the Assemblée Nationale. Here's a look back at a year full of twists, with four prime ministers, snap elections, and two caretaker governments.

title: End of Russian gas transit through Ukraine puts EU under pressure
summary: Kyiv and Moscow confirmed in two separate statements that Russian gas deliveries to Europe via Ukraine had ceased definitively on Wednesday morning. Despite the war, Russia is still one of Europe's main suppliers of gas, the price of which has soared to its highest level in over a year.

title: In New Year's address, Macron admits snap elections cause 'more divisions than solutions'
summary: In his December 31 address to the nation, his shortest since 2017, President Emmanuel Macron highlighted the successes of 2024 and hinted at possible referendums in 2025.

title: Mexican government steps up accommodating gestures toward Donald Trump
summary: Claudia Sheinbaum's administration has seized fentanyl, dispersed migrant caravans and confiscated millions of Chinese contraband products ahead of the US president-elect's inauguration on January 20.

title: At the Mayotte field hospital: 'We finally have the Rolls Royce of care'
summary: The 32 white tents of this temporary hospital accommodate an average of 200 people a day, from shantytown dwellers to the middle class. For the local population, the facility has become the most tangible sign of France's aid to its overseas territory, in the wake of Cy.

title: South Korea will send Jeju Air crash black box to US
summary: Korean, American and Boieng investigators are working on extracting the data to understand what caused the crash that killed 179 of the 181 people on board.

title: 2024 in elections: The year half the world's voting-age population went to the polls
summary: 2024 was been a historic electoral year, marked by major ballots around the world. The population living in countries where elections were held totaled 4.1 billion people – half of the planet's inhabitants. Here's a look back at a very special year.

title: Syria and the inevitability of failed transitions in Arab Spring countries
summary: In a country occupied by foreign powers, exhausted by a decade of civil war and located in a region where revolutions have destabilized institutions, the new authorities in Damascus face a monumental challenge in attempting to restore Syrian sovereignty.

title: Senegal president says no more 'foreign military presence from 2025'
summary: Faye's statement came a month after he announced that France would have to close its military bases in Senegal.

title: In the United Kingdom, 'Martha's Rule' allows patients to obtain a second medical opinion
summary: The introduction of this experiment in more than 100 hospitals across the country has saved lives by allowing a review of care or a change of treatment.

title: 'Nissan misjudged its vulnerability by unraveling its alliance with Renault'
summary: In difficulty, the Japanese group has been forced to join forces with its compatriot Honda, a marriage that makes little industrial sense. As for the French automaker, it has found itself isolated, fragile and limited in its ability to make the transition to electric vehicles, said Stéphane Lauer, editorial writer at 'Le Monde.'

title: Poland makes 'East Shield' core of its military power ambitions
summary: The country has embarked on a massive reinforcement of its defense infrastructure on the borders with Russia and Belarus. It aims to build Europe's leading army. But the government now in power must face up to the difficult legacy of its predecessors.

title: Boualem Sansal, dissident and author provocateur
summary: The French-Algerian writer, a lifelong opponent of Islamism, has been incarcerated in Algeria since November 16. His penchant for casting a sardonic eye at contemporary officialdom and societal divisions has made him an easy target for those in power.
